title: Educational Game Design Workshop for Scientific Inquiry: Integrated Approach to Experiments, Hypotheses, and Variables with Evidence-Based Conclusion Drawing

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic scientific experimental procedures (observation, hypothesis, variable control) and intermediate proficiency in digital tool utilization. Basic comprehension of experimental data measurement and analysis methods is required
context.additional_context: A course strengthening competency in designing science education games based on gameplay loops within a smartphone-centric, limited technological environment. Focuses on enhancing scientific inquiry skills (measurement, analysis, conclusion-drawing) for elementary school students, emphasizing hands-on experience from experimental design to evidence collection and interpretation.

learning_goals: Develop elementary science experiment design scenarios using the 3-stage gameplay loop (goal-action-feedback) (e.g., scientific hypothesis → independent variable manipulation → dependent variable measurement → evidence analysis).
Create a scientific inquiry design plan linking learning objectives (experiment design, data analysis, conclusion drawing) to game mechanics (points, levels, rewards) at ≥80% alignment.
Build a smartphone-optimized prototype in Figma, simulate scientific conclusion-drawing processes through user feedback, and evaluate inquiry skills.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
